oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SYNTHESIS, STRUCTURE AND CONDUCTIVITY OF NEW QUATERNARY CHALCOGENIDE SNBI4TE4SE4
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KICHAMBARE, PD
SHARON, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: one-dimensional metal
superconductivity
na3cu4s4
compound
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The new quaternary chalcogenide SnBi4Te4Se4 has been prepared by reaction among the elements at 900-degrees-C. The material is then characterized by X-ray diffraction, diffuse reflectance spectroscopy, EDAX and electrical conductivity. The compound exhibits a lower resistivity in the range of 0.07 to 0. 14 OMEGA cm at room temperature and with a carrier concentration 1.5 to 2.36 x 10(16) cm-3. ac susceptibility against temperature shows a weak diamagnetic response over a large temperature interval from 70 to 93 K.
